website_summaries.verdict: A good anchor buoy to have on hand for light dock work with smaller boats or for water ski slalom courses.
pros: PVC construction is durable enough to resist scratches and blemishes on the surface from jagged edges in the water
Anchor hole is small to easily thread lines around quickly
cons: Too small to be used on large speed boats, unless used with other similar buoys

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want it for slalom but to provide an anchor point for an inflated island. Works fine for that. I was expecting it to be larger (cause I didn't read the dimensions) but it is well made, heavy material. Looks like it will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Makes a perfect anchor buoy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as an anchor buoy. It is the perfect size to fit in your boat but large enough to be seen on the water. Attach one end of a line to the buoy and the other end to the anchor itself. This way, you will never lose your anchor even if the anchor rode is lost.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: pretty floaty
customer_reviews.text: these things love to stay above water. even with a taught anchor line, it's pulling up almost 10 lbs of weight. Great little bouy.
customer_reviews.author: bfresh80

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: So far seems pretty durable. My Bro-In-Law's dog swam out to it and tried biting it a few times and it has not leaked, so pretty happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: JLH

customer_reviews.title: economical solution to mark water
customer_reviews.text: Easy to inflate, strong eye for securing. Color has faded dramatically in 6 weeks. Used to identify swimming area at the end of dock.
customer_reviews.author: Gaylord Paul

customer_reviews.title: Careful of color
customer_reviews.text: The red color is much darker than illustrated. If you are looing for a brighter red then this will not do.
customer_reviews.author: Kilchomin

customer_reviews.title: but all in all the item is perfect for what I needed and the cost
customer_reviews.text: The hole could be a little bigger, I had to use a smaller rope than anticipated. but all in all the item is perfect for what I needed and the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give it no stars if I could. Aired it up and it leaked. My fault for waiting after the return period to air it up.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Askew

customer_reviews.title: Off Color From Description
customer_reviews.text: The product quality is fine but it is by no means ''Red" but rather is a pale redish pink in color. If you want a true "Red" this is not the one to purchase. Thought of returning it but not worth the hassle. The color that it is really doesn't stand out like a true red as expected and described within the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it was good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought to hold the anchor lines for our raft at the cottage. Shall see in Spring how it held up. Looks like it was good quality. The vendor delivered quickly and at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: ronald j. hax

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Use for our sprinkler intake. Floats like it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: MotherGoose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It’s a yellow ball. Not sure what else to say.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Anchor line ball!
customer_reviews.text: We use this for the anchor line on our sand shark auger. It is below the water surface and this helps from being run into in the lake.
customer_reviews.author: K from Waterford

customer_reviews.title: Excellent anchor rode buoy
customer_reviews.text: Used as a buoy for my jet ski rode in about 6-8ft of water. floats nicely and supports the stainless bow hook so I can hook and unhook without searching for the clip.
customer_reviews.author: A2theJackson

customer_reviews.title: Great Balls!
customer_reviews.text: I use them to mark my boat's shore anchors. I clip them on with a utility clip. Lady walked by it on the beach Saturday and kicked it! I guess she thought it was a ball just laying around. She got a surprise; the utility clip holds fast.
customer_reviews.author: M. H. Wright

customer_reviews.title: crabbing
customer_reviews.text: torpedo foam buoy too low profile in the water, really hard to see, using on crab trotline much higher profile
customer_reviews.author: frank j granger

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money for a good one.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. I used to mark the location of a mooring anchor for our Waverunner. After less than a month, it faded to the point that you can't even tell it used to be red and it also deflated. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Slappy1017

customer_reviews.title: Small and not bright enough to use as markers in water for swimming space.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 3 stars only because I was looking for something larger and more visible to identify space in the water from our dock for swimmers. I’ll need to order larger, brighter ones. These are probably fine for other uses.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn in Falls Church

customer_reviews.title: Priced right. Worked great. Fades tho
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for marking an anchor spot. Lasted all summer. I bought the red and it faded quite a bit, but don’t care. Price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Tutor

customer_reviews.title: Great producr
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, always get ar least two seasons out of them, even with hard use
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.Hoops,Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Cute.
customer_reviews.text: Just received it, so can’t speak to its durability, but seems good. Using it for a lake mooring - fits my little sailboat.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Barstow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought. Soft and meant for temporary use, not permanent.
customer_reviews.author: hogges

customer_reviews.title: How exactly to rate this. It floats. It ...
customer_reviews.text: How exactly to rate this. It floats. It is bouncy. It is green. My jet ski is smooshing that and not the dock.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy O

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what we needed, price was right!! Yellow color was great
customer_reviews.author: Rae Anne Seat

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: 2/3 I bought hold air. Be careful filling as they are fragile and pop easy.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Ploss

customer_reviews.title: Great for marking crab traps
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced and fit inside my crab trap for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R. Morin

customer_reviews.title: Availability
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product before and wanted to add to what I had.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Finn

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: We actually use this ad a dog toy. Strong enough our Bulldog can not pop, and can move and retrieve easily. My husband enforced the handle with wire and string so he could not chew off.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Whitehouse

customer_reviews.title: Great marker buoy for crabbing!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality marker buoy. Can't wait to use it this crab season!
customer_reviews.author: SaltyMolly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used as winter mark -- two months in so far, just fine
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Owen

customer_reviews.title: disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Already leaking around eyelet after 1 week. Seems too weak at this point, disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M. Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Dog love it!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to use it yet--as a buoy. My Standard Poodle is very intrigued by it, tho! Nice quality, looks good.
customer_reviews.author: E. B. Lamberts

customer_reviews.title: Not very good for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this slalom Buoy for a unique project I was working on. That being a ramp that a dog could get in and out of the water on. These buoy's were to hold up the end of the ramp. When received I found that you could only inflate them to 1-2 LBS, so the buoyancy of these were rather poor. Another teach of Amazon found some that did the trick, were bigger, and much tougher at only a couple of bucks more. Overall i was disappointed in the quality of these.
customer_reviews.author: Dwfreidell

customer_reviews.title: FYI - comes deflated - neede to go find a pump and needle!!
customer_reviews.text: Comes deflated. have to go find and buy a needle and pump to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: robred99

product_meta.title: Extreme Max 3006.7315 8.5" Slalom Buoy Yellow
product_meta.description: Color:YellowThis 8.5" inflatable buoy is made of chemical and UV-resistant PVC. Flexible, durable construction resists damage. Vibrant colors make this buoy ideally suited to mark anchors, moorings, or hazards, as well as swim areas or PWC race courses. 2-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Flexible and durable design for dependable performance
Ideally suited to mark anchors, moorings, or hazards, as well as swim areas or PWC race courses

specifications.Model: Extreme Max 3006.7315 BoatTector Slalom Buoy - 8.5", Yellow
specifications.Cover Included: Extreme Max 3006.7315 BoatTector Slalom Buoy - 8.5", Yellow
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars171 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
